intro: Cliffortia laricina, commonly known as the silverleaf oxalis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking silver-green leaves and clusters of delicate, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is a member of the Oxalidaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Cliffortia laricina is relatively low maintenance and drought-tolerant once established.
